Giving                                                                  Academics                                                                   Each year we head deeper into the 21st century, more complex challenges reveal themselves. Solving them will require a new breed of thinkers. It will require taking intellectual risks and cross-disciplinary collaboration. Mechanical engineers will need to work with biochemists, physicists and telecommunication experts to develop biosensors that wirelessly transmit environmental test results. Digital media artists will need to work with information technologists, doctors and civil engineers to create the hospital of the future. Computer scientists, mathematicians and electrical engineers will need to work together to produce a supercomputer to run the new power grid.   At the School of Engineering, academics are focused on cultivating students’ research, thinking and problem-solving skills so that they can be members of such teams. Our rigorous coursework is built on the fundamentals; hands-on projects promote active learning. Freedom to experiment with new solutions and unconventional approaches allows students to enter their profession or go on to an advanced degree program with confidence and unmatched experience. NYU Engineering                                                                  NYU Engineering                       Engineering is…                 Creative Mobile Life Global Now                                Engineering is…            Creative in its approach, mobile in its ability to shape the future,     and life -changing in its applications. Set in the heart of Brooklyn’s     Tech Triangle, the urban learning space is made global at NYU’s School     of Engineering. The moment for engineering is now . Learn more about     our place at the epicenter of invention, innovation, and     entrepreneurship through each of these interactive stories. Engineering is NYU .                                          Engineering is creative                                   Our students are artists, engineers, and entrepreneurs working in      extraordinarily challenging and fluid industries that reward the       creative and the innovative . The yearly Inno/Vention competition gives      students the opportunity to prototype and pitch their ideas      to professors and industry experts who mentor them and help turn their      concepts into realities. The new MAGNET       facility brings together four NYU schools in order to bridge the gap between the Arts, Education,      Engineering and Math and create unusual collaborations . The Game Innovation Lab       helps move gaming from purely entertainment to educational and aids in the expansion       of a burgeoning economic sector in New York.                                                       Engineering is Play         Katherine Isbister. I am making everyday interaction with technology fun by designing playful video games that use nontraditional controllers to create innovative user experiences focusing on emotion, learning and social interaction.         Watch Now                                          Unlocking The Social Benefits of Gaming         Watch Now                                          HeartShare Art Share: Artists with Disabilities         Learn More                                          Circuit Training: New Electronics Prototyping Lab Now Available to Students         Learn More                                          Designers to Take On Urban Energy Challenges during NYC ACRE Design Jam         Learn More                                          MAGNET: Bridging the Gap Between Technology and Culture         Learn More                                          Jasmine Hume / Graduate Student         Watch Now                                          Economic Impact Study         Learn More                                          DuBois's 'NOW' will be'...a something         Learn More                                                   Engineering is mobile                                   We are mobile in many ways. We equip our faculty and students with      tools and resources as they move their inspiration into the      applications domain. We are mobile because NYU has a successful track      record of providing bona fide paths for creative students to the      middle class and beyond, and will continue to foster upward mobility:      forty percent of our students are the first in their families to      attend college and we were recently voted #3 among all schools by       PayScale 2013 College Return On Investment Report .       We are mobile also because we are global. Mobility is not just about taking you upward; it is about taking everyone along as well.                                                    Engineering is Streaming         Shiv Panwar. I am creating video streaming technology called streamloading for high definition mobile video at low data costs by reducing cellular bandwidth through caching, traffic time shifting, network coding and adaptive video transmission.         Learn More                                          Crack that Password? Not in a Billion Years         Learn More                                          Buyer Beware: NYU Researchers Uncover Security Breach that Reveals EBay Purchases         Learn More                                          NSA Names NYU School of Engineering to Exclusive List of Cyber Security Programs         Learn More                                          NYU-Poly "Hacks" the MTA         Learn More                                          Nasir Memon / Professor of Computer Science         Watch Now                                          Small School, Big ROI         Learn More                                          NYU-Poly Innovation Centers Named Among World's Top University Business Incubators         Learn More                                                   Engineering is Life                                   NYU Engineers are creating a collaborative environment where new ideas      come to life . These ideas take many forms from clean energy to robotic      fish. Whether it’s detecting the world’s smallest viruses in our       bioengineering labs, discovering new proteins, making new materials,      interfacing unique medical instrumentation using wireless network, or      making meaningful sense of big data , our diverse student and faculty      body do more than study and research in bio-related areas; they seek      out answers to provide for a brighter future using engineering tools      to understand the world and improve the quality of life on earth.                                                    Engineering is Bionic         Jonathan Viventi. I am designing thin, flexible silicone brain implants to control seizures, cardiac pacemakers, defibrillators, cochlear and retinal implants and cutting edge neuroprosthetic systems.         Watch Now                                          Do You Fidget, Fiddle, or Doodle While You Work?         Learn More                                          New York University School of Engineering Students Win Prize to Revolutionize the Technology of Diving         Learn More                                          Engineering a Protein to Prevent Brain Damage from Toxic Agents         Learn More                                          Xiaoxiang Xu / Graduate Student         Watch Now                                          Detecting the World's Smallest Virus         Learn More                                          Joe Landolina’s Medi-Gel offers an innovative solution to veterinary care and beyond         Learn More                                          NYU-Poly ranks top 10 in innovation and racial diversity; top 20 in economic diversity         Learn More                                                   Engineering is global                                   NYU has been regarded "in and of the city" for a long time, but now      with its extraordinary global presence, it is "in and of the world".      With additional portal campuses in Abu Dhabi       and Shanghai , students      can take courses in their chosen field while advancing their      understanding of the world and its ways. Based in Brooklyn , our      students are embedded in city life; they are inventing mobile apps to      make commuters ride more comfortable, inventing lighter and more      durable building materials , and envisioning greener cities .                                                    Engineering is Materials         Nikhil Gupta. I am using nanotechnology to create lightweight composites, like metallic syntactic foam, to create safer, stronger, more energy-efficient vehicles and to design the latest protective safety gear like helmets and body armor..         Watch Now                                          Building Bridges and Calculating Costs         Learn More                                          Engineers Abroad: NYU Polytechnic Engineering Students Talk Globe-Trotting, Culture, and Expanding Horizons         Learn More                                          Birthday Celebration Fit for a Renaissance Man         Learn More                                          Charles Tapiero / Professor of Finance and Risk Engineering         Watch Now                                          Science of Smart Cities Malaysia 2013         Learn More                                          NYU-Poly Competes in US Department of Energy’s Biennial Solar Decathlon         Learn More                                          Cellular Concrete with Social Impact         Watch Now                                                   Engineering is now                                   Our incubators offer the knowledge, the means, and the space for      innovators to nurture their ideas, and were voted one of “2012 Top 10      Idea Labs” by Worth magazine. Our K-12 STEM Education       seeks to extend the reach of the university’s high-quality programs to engage young      students and their teachers in order to jumpstart the next generation      of engineers. The Cyber Security Awareness Week Competition,      now in its 10th year, is the largest competition of its kind and hones      the talent of future cyber security experts. We engage young students       now . NYU's School of Engineering is working to diminish the gender gap in STEM      fields and will prepare everyone for a bright future.                                                    Engineering is STEM         Vikram Kapila. I am using robotics and mechatronics to teach students math and science skills they need to be prepared for the innovation economy. I work with NYC school teachers to develop curriculum using Next Generation Science Standards.          Watch Now                                          Entrepreneur and Alum Joe Landolina Chosen as 2014 TED Fellow         Learn More                                          Summer of STEM: Choosing the Classroom Over the Beach         Learn More                                          NYU Joins the White House for #nationofmakers: Creating the Makers of Tomorrow Since 1854         Learn More                                          The Future Is Now: Innovation Square Comes to NYU-Poly         Learn More                                          Closing the Gap with Robotics         Watch Now                                          Hacking Competition Tests Participants’ Cyber Security Skills         Learn More                                          How Justin Cappos Created a New Way to Cloud Compute         Learn More                                          Nicolette Nunez - Undergraduate Student Profile         Watch Now                                                                            The Merger             On January 1, 2014, NYU-Poly joined the largest private research      university in America as its School of Engineering, returning the      discipline to NYU after a 40-year gap. Its drive to push the      boundaries of what it means to be a 21st century research institution,      grounded on the principles of invention, innovation, and      entrepreneurship, has and will continue to lead to new strides. The      addition of the School of Engineering to the robust academic offerings      at NYU will aid in the creation of a more enlightened community that      is literate and technologically savvy at the same time.                                             “ We create new knowledge for the future and turn it into       wisdom through experience. We are equally aware of our responsibility       to solve the problems of today, so we can be active partners in the       growth and success of our local community, New York and, eventually,       the world.”              Katepalli R. Sreenivasan , NYU-Poly President, NYU Dean of Engineering                                 Engineering is NYU            Follow Us       Twitter Facebook Vimeo                         Learn More       © NYU Polytechnic School of Engineering
